result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard W. Daniels was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Richard W. Daniels is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Richard W. Daniels was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Fine/costs were paid in full by defendant.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard W. Daniels

defendant.name: Daniels, Richard W.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: MARQUETTE COUNTY DNA PROOF OF SUBMISSION

Defendant Richard W. Daniels in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that he did meet with the defendant and an offer was provided.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant would like to accept the offer.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.    Court finds waiver of Attorney made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 2.  Ct. 1 to be dismissed.  Defendant enters a Guilty plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.    Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 2.  Ct. 1 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the recommendation.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 2:  Pay fine and costs = $442.00
  DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
Defendant will pay today

Pre-trial conference on May 24, 2016 at 08:45 am.
Return date on June 16, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
*No contact with Janina Pafford.  *Appear for booking

Defendant Richard W. Daniels in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause to continue the prosecution of this matter.  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
Atty Hendee requests signature bond with conditions.  BY THE COURT:  Court sets signature bond with conditions.
  Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.  Court questions defendant and finds the waiver of counsel to be made freely, voluntarily and intelligently.  Set for return and PTC.  Return date scheduled for June 16, 2016 at 03:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 24, 2016 at 08:45 am.
